reviews.review: I love the setting and combat in this game. One of the best shooters I have played in some time! The combat sequences are truly unique and can be approached in any way you see fit.

I was never a fan of BioShock 1 or 2 but really, BioShock Infinite is brilliant. Graphics are very well done and the storyline makes you keep guessing until the end where it spreads it out. Pay attention in the game or forget about the storyline completely. I simply adore this game, I was sceptical, but it was worth the money for sure, and then some.

While this game is fantastic to play it appears to have mutated some what since the various trailers were announced. The world feels static as small bits of trash and debris do not fly around during combat. Which is odd since Bioshock 1 & 2 featured this and it was shown in the trailers. The open world aspect shown via skyline across large maps did not materialize either. Instead they are mostly just compact tactical ramps on more modest maps. 

It feels as though this game is but half of a larger more indepth game that was cut down into a smaller but still intensely enjoyable package. All the marks of the cutting are there from the trailers to the left in art assets for various areas. 

I would wager the lack of physics objects and smaller maps is a symptom of the small contraining the large. Where as this game had big plans and show stopping trailers. The final product had to be cut down for console play. As larger levels and physics would be causing all kinds of lag with the advanced graphics. 1999 mode is sort of a tacked on bust as well. 3x health enemies and if you run out of money from dying you go back to main menu. Do not get me wrong however this game is extremely fun though a tad short. Though not as short as dishonored.

Hey Ken Levine, since 1999 mode is not that great. How about we get a 2011 mode as depicted in the trailer of that year? Let us play through those little trailer areas.

"Боже мой! Это божественно! Это гениально!" - такие мысли были в моей голове на протяжении всего времени, проведённого в шедевральном BioShock Infinite.
Уже через полтора часа сюжет начал завязываться в узлы, создавая множество вопросов, но этим самым и затягивая. После прохождения игры (особенно бесподобной её концовки) в голове сразу появилась буря эмоций, старающихся вырваться наружу, но лучше промолчать, чтоб не испортить ощущения от игры тем, кто ещё не прошёл этот BioShock. 
Отдельная деталь геймплея - Элизабет, которую нам надо спасти. Её поведение, чувства - всё как у реального человека, что даже забываешь, что она всего лишь игровой персонаж. Она помогает в бою, сочувствует, злится, разглядывает особенности мира, в который она вышла, после многих лет заточения. И всё это делает настолько натурально, как никакой персонаж в игре не делал на моей памяти. И плюс у неё есть способность открывать порталы в другое измерение, а так же другие особенности оставляют уйму вопросов, но всё разъясняется к финалу.
Атмосфера приносит нас в эту альтернативную реальность прямо на руках, а каждая мелочь в игре связанна с другой - ничего просто так не случется.
Эта самая впечатлительная игра в которую я играл, я уверен, что каждый оценит гениальность её создателей.

BioShock > Infinite. It's not the masterpiece they make you believe. Lots of déjà vu clichés and Elizabeth's overrated character is neither that revolutionary, nor that interesting. NOT TO MENTION UNSIGHTLY LATIN GRAMMATICAL MISTAKES! On top of that I didn't like the cheap BioShock cameo towards the end (and the ending itself) at all.

ADDENDA:
Burial at Sea - Shame on you 2K!

Il furbetto "Burial at Sea" è niente po' po' di meno che un vero e proprio oltraggio: un pajo di mappe inconcludenti e MANCO DOPPIATE IN ITALIANO! Stiamo parlando di 2K, non un poveraccio indipendente con le pezze al culo. E di un titolo che ha incassato milioni. Per dire due frasette del cazzo, poi. Fanculo, mi son di nuovo fatto fregare coi Season Pass del menga. Scemo io.

Episode 2 = BioShock Infinithief!

A fantastic First Person Shooter that is completely bizarre and amazing at the same time. The setting of a floating city in the clouds called Columbia looks fantastic, sometimes you may need to just stop and admire the view, this game is clearly well designed. This game really nails the 1912 theme, the game definitely has the feeling of that era. 
While gameplay has received mixed opinions from various different critics and gamers alike, I personally enjoyed the gameplay and finding hidden items such as voxophones (audio recordings) and infusions (upgrades) felt rewarding. 
Story and characters are very well crafted, but Elizabeth steals the show. Learning about her history throughout the game is interesting to say the least and you never expect the twist at the end. 
People can argue all they want saying this game is over-rated, but there's no denying that it's a game worth playing.
Very re-playable and highly recommended!
game of the year, period.

If I'm honest with myself, the gameplay is only 'meh.' It is an 11 hour simplistic shooter with no cover mechanics, no stealth component, and uncreative enemy AI. I would say the original was a better game. But it doesn't matter, because Ken Levine and his team can spin a story like nobody else.  If you're not consumed by the world they've created, if you aren't deeply invested in the characters and their problems, then you're simply dead inside. Believe me when I tell you that you need to own this game.
play dis nao for the love of god, NAO

Alright, so you play as a dead-beat detective that owes some money to people you do not wanna mess with.......or DOES he?? 

You eventually get called to a lighthouse [surprise, surprise] looking to meet up with these people and clear your debt.....or ARE you?? 

You then get blased into the sky, landing on this floating fortress and start fuckin the place up. You gotta get this girl, which of course goes perfectly smooth and nothing uneventful happens....or DOES it?!?! 

And then the game ends with a super borning conclusion and doesn't leave you with a feeling that your brain has just been raped by a giant "plot octopus" who leaves you with more questions than you had through the entire game.....jk it totally does.

Buy this game, ya dingus!
I took like 300+ screenshots playing through this. Why. (It's good.)

AWESOME
10 OF 10
This game is FUCKING awesome everyone should play it !! Especialy the storyline makes it perfect. The best game I played this year.

An absolutely fantastic game. Such an emotional story, it really brings you in and makes you feel for the characters. Not as "scary" as the previous Bioshock games, but don't take that as a negative aspect. The game is visually beautiful, and the characters you come across are diverse. ** SPOILER** The dimension traveling parts of the game got a little confusing at first, but by the end it all came together. Seriously, my mouth was agape for probably the last 20 minutes of gameplay. Not one, but two twists at the end! This game really affected me, and I felt a wave of emotion once I finished the game. Truly, one of the best games I've ever played.
Had to pick this one up after Game Informer gave it a 10/10. Quite literally the most enthralling story I've experienced since Dead Space in 2008, I played through this without putting it down

Я знал, что игра мне понравится, еще когда нажимал кнопку "Купить" в Steam Store. Но я даже не предполагал, что она будет настолько великолепной!

Игра начинается снова с маяка, но чувство дежавю улетучивается очень быстро.  После темных сырых коридоров Восторга Колумбия сражает наповал. Город получился отменно. Первое время действительно ходишь с открытым ртом и просто рассматриваешь все вокруг.

Игровая механика почти не изменилась по сравнению с предыдущими частями, а рельсы действительно вносят разнообразие в геймплей, но это лишь средство подачи отличной истории и отходит на второй план в этой игре.

Главной находкой и изюминкой игры является Элизабет. Поражает, с каким трогательным вниманием разработчики отнеслись к ней. Я уверен, что каждый игрок-парень немного влюбляется в Элизабет, и у каждого будет любимый момент, связанный с ней. Очень быстро понимаешь, что именно она главный герой, а не игрок, но это даже лучше, очень интересно наблюдать, как она меняется по ходу игры. Стоит сказать, что Элизабет - самый совершенный и милый  напарник в играх. Она не путается под ногами, дает аптечки, боеприпасы, деньги и вообще ведет себя, как заправский солдат. А как она реанимирует героя! Даже этой тривиальной процедуре разработчики уделили кучу внимания. О ней можно говорить очень много!

Конечно я поставлю этой игре максимум баллов из возможного и буду ее обязательно рекомендовать всем! В ней есть небольшие недоточеты, но они совсем не важны!

P.S. Я знаю многих, кто считает игры глупостью, пустой тратой времени и уж точно не искусством. А я рад, что прожил еще несколько часов в мире Bioshock, именно прожил, а не проиграл. И теперь, если кто-то скажет, что игры не искусство, я просто улыбнусь и скажу два слова:"Bioshock Infinite".
its called bioshock infinite but its not infinite, this game lies even in the title. truly crushed my expectations
I came.
Resembling more of Bioshock one, Bioshock Infinite is a very fast-paced, strategic, and beautiful FPS. Along with the masterly crafted gameplay it has a deep, complicated, and engaging story!

Неплохой гемплей, особенно учитывая выбор стиля и оружия, опираясь на разломы и трассы для передвижения, - приятно короче. 

Но таки "но".. Динамика боя и однотипные враги  успевают надоесть чуть раньше, чем нужно. Впрочем, всё компенсирует концовка.  Отлично закрученный сюжет, что частнично казался предсказуемым, но остался живым. В общем пройти разок рекомендую. Не прошлые биошоки, но и.. Не прошлые биошоки :) Своих денег стоит.
It's... beautiful
Best ego-shooter ever!
A quick, colourful trip through a marvellously told story.
A game where I can say only one thing: buy it! :)
Хардкорна и печальна,но афигенна и интересна

Uma das melhores histórias que já vi em um jogo. Excelente ambientação, ótimos cenários e uma boa jogabilidade, sendo que esta última pode decepcionar um pouco quem está acostumados com FPSs como BF3.

Um dos melhores jogos que já tive o prazer de jogar, sem dúvida

i recomend bioshock 2 tho shits lit being a big daddy and all

(9 from 10)

Bioshock:Infinite was more in the vein what I had originally wanted from Bioshock 1. And here is why: 

1.	It shows the high times of this unique society and its downfall. Unlike the first Bioshock, were you pretty much arrive when most people already left, or died or gone complete crazy.

2.	You had a sweet and helpful companion with you (Elizabeth), which in my book is always a plus.

3.	It had an interesting ending overall. While you had an extraordinary revelation during mid/endgame of Bioshock 1. The real ending of Bioshock 1 was as generic as it gets.

4.	Skyhooks added a certain variety to the generic shooting experience in Bioshock 1. They tried that in Bioshock 1 by adding odd minigames.

5.	Graphics are improved, still you often see for which platform it was aimed for (Protip: It was not the PC). They worked with graphical tricks to improve memory management and sometimes it gets ugly.

So If not just like to kill some time, but get emotionally involved into an unusual game and its world, you should give it a try!

At least the viewmodels looked nice.

Sometimes.

El juego del año 2013 y me atrevería a decir que estamos ante un juego tan épico como Half-Live y PORTAL 1 - 2 que pasará a la historia de los videojuegos como un grande. Imprescindible jugarlo. 10/10
Quite possibly the best game you will every play. Period.

Bioshock Infinite is a game of next generation: with Alyx Vance of next generation, Dr. Breen of next generation and even G-Man of next generation (2 of them).

If say serious, it is a very nice game with good mechanics and perfect design.

One of the best FPS story shooters I've played in a long time. Very well done, the graphics are good, and the story telling only gets more interesting until the end. The ending is very well done, but really bites on your memory and observation skills to put the pieces together and understand the story.

If you don't buy this game, then something's wrong with you.

GOTY for sure.

Le pari était lancé de sortir un nouveau Bioshock. Un retour à Rapture aurait été certainement un échec. Dans ce nouvel opus, nous voici dans les airs. A Columbia, une mégapole au milieu des nuages. Le rendu est tout simplement magnifique. L'ambiance, qui est un des points forts de la série Bioshock, est simplement parfaite. A la fois glauque et complétement déjanté, cette univers vous transporte hors du temps. Attention l'histoire est la plus incroyable de tous les jeux que j'ai joué. Une grosse claque, un MASTERPIECE. Vous ne serez plus le même après avoir fini ce Bioshock Infinite!
Bioshock Infinite Has Got An Extreme Cool Story Line. Just Go And Play It. It's ART!!!
Лучше доты )

I avoided the two+ years of previews, announcements, E3 demos, trailers, and everything else hundreds of millions of dollars in advertising buys for this game. Had no clue what it was going to be about other than "the new Bioshock game from the makers of the original one." That's probably why I'm so impressed by it.

Though I usually play games on Normal mode, I played through this one on Hard and feel like that's absolutely the way to do it. (Only 13% of players seem to have followed suit.) This isn't the sort of on-rails "carnival ride" that's become synonymous with "AAA" gaming.  Most sequences aren't scripted, and fights generally take place in open areas with lots of approaches. You'll be backtracking for health and ammo (which is often scarce), so the fact that there's a significant amount of optional story/upgrade content revealed for exploration makes you look forward to doing so. In fact, a lot of those battleground spots are wide open enough that you don't get to really see it all until after the music calms down to denote "everyone around is dead."

Unlike Borderlands, if you're playing a recording and someone starts to talk, the recording mutes for the talking. You can't cancel out the "this will only be said once" dialogue so easily, and you can replay all the past recordings. Note: the "Gameplay" menu it keeps talking about is NOT the "Gameplay" menu that appears when you hit Escape. Press "O." That was dumb of them, to have two sub-screens with the same name. But that'll let you replay all past recordings, check your objectives, and change your gear (items that confer passive effects, many of which are quite good).

Like the first Bioshock, you can only carry two weapons at a time. You can only quick toggle between two powers at once as well, though the game will pause if you want to select a new ability. Between this and the upgrade system, there's little incentive to diversify your loadout. Especially when re-enacting the Hitchcock 3D horror movie is so effective; upgrade that so it creates traps if you kill someone affected by it and you will be a BEAST. On the subject of traps: USE THEM. There are sections of the game that are intentionally quite difficult without them, and in Platinum Games fashion these are meant to be "gates." As in, the developers figure "the player should really use this if they wish to proceed past this point." 

Unfortunately, as is also Platinum Games fashion, almost everyone playing did not figure this out because there is no gameplay tip displayed on screen or character verbally telling you "you probably want to try this now." Sure, you're informed traps exist each time you get a new ability, but it's up to you to figure out to use them. Global Achievement stats tell the story: 58.1% of Bioshock Infinite owners beat the game (13% on Hard). Only 25% bothered to even USE the traps. This is why you hear people SUPER pissed off at the "boss" encounters, saying "Irrational, you done effed it up!" Those people opted to brute force respawn through tough encounters. Don't do this. USE THE TRAPS. If you walk into an area and see enemies unaware? SET TRAPS. You will save many, many bullets. To not do so is to resign yourself to a cyclical fate of respawning with not enough ammo.

Bioshock Infinite is a damned good *game*. I'm not slogging through it just for its story and characters (both of which are also quite good). We live in a world where lots of people think "oh, I'll just watch a Youtube video of someone playing it, because I want to treat games the same way that I treat film and television [also, I don't want to devote the money/time myself]." The people who do that are doing the medium a disservice and only perpetuating the on-rails uber-linearity of "AAA" games. I say nuts to that. I say murder a bunch of dudes, then zoom the camera super close to their awesomely mutilated bodies and take screenshots.  Why, I took several hundred for this game alone!

This game is fucking fantastic. If you enjoyed the first Bioshock, this one offers an equally jaw-dropping experience and even tops the incredible story of the first. The gameplay is perfected, involving even more plasmids (vigors) and guns. The environment is thriving, interesting, and always has something awesome to look at. Overall, it's definitely one of the best games I've ever played, and it has the best damn ending to any game ever. 10/10

If you dont take the time to play this game, than your an idiot. Hands down one of the best stories i have ever experienced in gaming history. Plus the graphics are top notch and the combat is simply amazing. Bioshock Infinite is an instant classic and should be in everyones library
The storyline is entertaining, and the graphics are super colorful and bright. I really did enjoy this game all the way through.

Anything that I could possibly say about this game has already been said by any major and minor reviewer out there. Absolutely incredible, and is tied for my personal favorite game of all time with Bioshock 1.

A fantastic game with amazing gameplay, a beautiful world, well-developed characters, new and interesting enemies, and a fantastic story. The game kept me wanting to play more and it really pulled me into the story. The ending was a bit confusing, but nontheless, was amazing. Easily one of the best games of 2013 and definitely one of the best games I have ever played.
This game has an incredibly addictive storyline. And it's Bioshock. 'Nuff said.

Spoilers and Poetry ahead, you've been warned. 

The outlook wasn't brilliant for poor Booker D. that night,
While sitting in a lifeboat, with the lighthouse gleaming bright;
And when the rowers vanished, and the surface did the same,
A sickly silence fell upon the hero of this game.

And in the rocket pod he sat, bewildered,yet impressed,
As he drifted past the Monument, and as "pilgrim" was addressed;
He thought, though much befuddled, "I can swing this rescue yet - 
Bringing them the girl, to wipe away the debt." 

But Booker's fame preceded him, as did the prophet's hate; 
And the former was a mystery, and the latter was his fate.
So upon our calm protagonist, grim melancholy lay,
As he wandered through Columbia, one pleasant summer's day.

For there were weird anomalies, awaiting on this trip:
An odd predictive telegram, and a coin that he must flip;
When he came upon the fairground, a baseball in his grasp,
The telegram proved Prophetic, and the "Shepherd" was entrapped. 

The policemen sent to fetch him, though, emerged in fearful shape,
As DeWitt procured his skyhook in a bloody quick escape;
He killed the hothead fireman, and the soldiers' onslaught checked,
As the presence of the Shepherd began to have a mass effect. 

And he struck a blow for freedom, put the Ravens in their place,
Stole Lizzie from the statue, with a grimace on his face,
Endured the propaganda, so veiled and ornate,
And in the halls of history, found cause to clean his Slate.

Ten thousand Founders fought him, and found that fighting hurts;
Ten thousand Vox applauded him in another universe.
Fitzroy had incited them, the Prophet's rule to end,
And Comstock wouldn't tolerate this Columbian-mocha blend.

For now the Vox Rebellion was heady in the air,
As Booker and Elizabeth chased gunsmiths through the tears;
He found himself a martyr, the rebels’ hero dead;
"That ain't my style," said Booker, as in a blimp he fled.

From the working town of Finkton, though, the city fell to storm; 
And through Emporia's empty streets, a trail of blood was worn.
A strange and spectrous spectacle was born from daughter's hate - 
And through the touch of mother's hand, they opened Comstock's gate.

Our hero passed through time and space, by silent boys forlorn,
And through the future's meddling, a self from past was warned;
One mountain drowned in fire; one spared from Prophet's rage - 
And the note was found to be the key to break the Songbird's CAGE. 

The bird succumbed to atmosphere, as was his destiny,
As the pair both stood enraptured, in the city beneath the sea;
They saw the timestreams branching through a million lighthouse doors,
In a world most Irrational, where futures are restored.

But the memories stored in Booker's mind were all subject to change,
In this universal chess game that the physicists arranged;
For to save himself and Anna, a destiny is faced - 
And at the river delta, his parallels erased.

Oh, somewhere in the multiverse, the stars are twinkling bright,
And Jack is fighting Atlas, 'mid Rapture's neon lights,
And always there's a city, where twin Luteces pout;
But there is no more Columbia...

... for mighty Comstock was struck out.

 - ZeroKelvin & Ernest Thayer

This game is beautiful, intelligent and just a work of art.  I love history and scifi and the Bioshock series blends these two together so well on top of the exceptional narrative/story. I have to say after playing infinite, it has come close to surpassing the original bioshock. Its a must buy for anyone who loves being immersed in a world/story with FPS gameplay. 10/10

What an amazing game! The storyline was the most amazing and shocking I have ever seen. The graphics are great but the best about this game is the mind-blowing story and ending! Elizabeth took me on a ride of emotionals and astonishment!

After years, I played this game and its sweet DLCs again. I see the main story as my one and only canon.
But the side dlc "conclusion"-story is also very interisting made. I wish I could see more of the DeWitts. This game is the most tragic and bitter-sweet father-daughter-adventure, ever!


Bird or cage - Forever and ever!

We just don't get games like this often enough. I wish there was more for me to tell you about, but everything is perfect. The story, the progression, the characters, the gameplay; it all wraps itself together like the most elegant little bow. Never a dull moment either, the story keeps you on the edge all the way to the end when it takes hold of your hand, smiles, and then delightfully explodes in a fustercluck of the mind. Simply brilliant experience. Everyone must play this game. Instant classic. 10 / 10
This is the best Bioshock that I have ever played.  I liked the game so much that I was heartbroken when the game came to an end.
Play this game.  I mean right now.
One of the best games I have played

This is the game all the other games want to be when they grow up. As a single experience just running through the game and story it's quite possibly the best game I've ever played. There is also 1999 mode which ramps the difficulty up to an insane level for those wanting more challenge. (see punishment) At any rate, I RECCOMEND THIS GAME.

Compared to previous incarnations of the series we have a story line that is much more in the moment than what was past tense in previous games, a location that is even more beautiful and inspiring, gameplay is top of the line (combat is significantly better than previous games in the series). The short list of complaints about this game reads as such: I beat it in less than 20 hours after spending a lot of time trying to look for acheievement completions (still missed a few, apparently), there's not really bosses to speak of, just a handful of really difficult to kill Handymen, and the story explains almost everything except why Elizabeth is a God, something that, when you think about it, is probably pretty essential to the plot.

When even bad reviewers are forced to say a great thing about the game before a small flaw... u know it's gonna be amazing. Great awesome game!

Still one of the best!

Fantastic game. Best Bioshock of the series imo. Story will blow your mind, I loved the way Elizabeth stayed with Booker but never gets in the way, best AI to date. Combat is fantastic, the world of Columbia will make you never want to leave. Def must play!

Oh. My. God. This game. There are not enough words to describe in such a MAGNIFICENT game in such a short recommendation. First and foremost, one of the most beatiful, most emotional, and active story lines EVER in a game. I would recommend it just based on that. But no! It gets better. The combat is INNOVATIVE, FUN, and does NOT get boring. Although unlike the original bioshocks, you can only carry 2 weapons at once. The vigors (plasmids) are fun, but I usually only stuck to one or two myself. Finally, the characters. My god. The characters. So engaging, so entertaining, and they make you feel so connected to them. One of the best games of 2013, one of the best games ever. Do NOT, I repeat, no NOT be the one to miss out on this game, this experience!
GOTY 10/10
Beautiful game with great story!
A seriously must-play game. You will not be disappointed.
Amazing!
story - awesome mindfuck / gameplay - huge fun with great variety of possibilities / character, level and production design - outstanding / definitly 10 out of 10

As much as I want to do it, I cannot call Bioshock Infinite a masterpiece. Though it wouldn't surprise me if it's in a museum one day for all the things it does brilliantly (graphics, art direction, level design, sound, the way Elizabeth acts as a companion) I do think there is one thing holding it back: a somewhat obnoxious story. Now I know, everyone is raving about it, but I just can't do it. The first disruption that isn't spoiling anything is in my opinion sloppy writing because of the way portals are used  (ie. Look! Our main characters made a mistake! Why don't we just open this Plot Device™ and all their problems will vanish!) This kind of thing was well-executed early on but it quickly became obnoxious and essentially an overused gimmick by the end. I have an even bigger gripe with the ending but I won't spoil it. So if you don't hold story as the biggest component of a game, there is no doubt that this will likely be your Game of the Year. But if you were expecting a blockbuster story to go along with those eye-candy graphics, I think you'll know what I mean. Still worthy of a 9 out of 10.
ストーリーは半分まで来て今んとこ一本道。ただ、没入感がハンパ無く、掛け値無しに面白い。難易度はノーマルでもかなり低めだが、ストーリー命なので初見はこれもアリ。あとエリザベスが可愛すぎる。
Bloody toppers
สนุกดีครับ แต่ถ้าอ่านนิยาย sci-fi มาเยอะ จะเดาเรื่องได้ง่ายไปหน่อย
Однозначно лучший сюжет  и один из лучших геймплеев всех времен и народов.
Awesome

Got through this game in 15 hours by taking my time, but despite that it's still worth the full AAA-release price tag. Why? Incredibly awesome story, that's why. Never has any video game conveyed a meaningful, deep story with excellent attention to detail, foreshadowing, meaning within meaning, and just plain brilliant execution quite like BioShock Infinite. It sets a new standard for what I expect in stellar story telling in any video game from here on. Highly recommended. The "10/10" reviews, for the first time ever in my experience, are RIGHT.
Very well made game. Great mechanics, combat, and an amazing story that will blow your mind. This has got to be the game of the year.
Pick it up when it goes on sale, it is so good.
If you liked Bioshock, you'll like Inifnite (probably).  Less water, but more racism!  Great overall.

One of the best games I have played ever. Great story line, and a lot of back plots if you want to follow which add to the game's experience. Overall BUY THIS GAME, espically if you can get this on a special then get it. if not, then still buy it.
Tidenes..?
Game of the year. One of the best  singleplayer shooter.
Plays, played, will play.

If you haven't heard of this game you must be living under a rock. Drop everything and get it now. Give up food for the week if you're strapped for cash. Seriously. Worth it.

Best story and character development I've seen in a game in a long time, and it's a pretty decent FPS too.  It's not perfect and it's not the best game ever, but it's damn good.
Maybe it's still too early to decide a game of the year, but this game is definitely at the top of my list. Great story, great gameplay. Escort mission at its best!

文句なしに面白いしエリザベスがかわいいけど、
BioShock3ではなくBioShock Infiniteなので、
今までの続編だと思ってやるとコレジャナイ感がすごいと思う。
あとエンディングが個人的には受け入れがたい。
Skjønner godt at dette spillet har fått 10/10 flere steder.. det er bare helt utrolig fengende og overraskende.. vil ikke røpe noe.. men kjøp det!
Nice story and dense FPS action (high difficulty strongly recommended)

Gameplay wise is not so special but the artworks, story, characters, music are STUNNING.. I've finished this game two times and plan to finish another playthrough in 1999 mode. Bioshock Infinite is an unforgetable experience... A masterpiece.

9.9/10 - Because no game is perfect. But, holy shit does this one come close.

Pros : 
-Absolutely enthralling story from start to finish.
-A world soaked with such detail and backstory that you can feel the love and hard
work put into crafting EVERY. SINGLE. AREA.
-On the proper machine, absolutely gorgeus graphically.
-Ridiculously fun combat (with a few minor, easily overlookable flaws.)
- A companion AI that pushes the boundaries of what a companion AI can be in a video game.

Cons:
-Somewhat poor implementation of Vigors (basically Plasmids from the orignal Bioshock and it's sequel, Bioshock 2.)
-Limited to having only 2 weapons at any given time, reflecting a rather Call Of Duty esque approach. I assume to appeal to fans of that type of FPS system of gameplay. Unfortunately that decision, at times, proves to create moments where you are forced to play with guns you don't particular like. However, this is a minor flaw. And only a flaw in MY opinion. 

And that's really that for cons in my opinion. 
Anywho, GET THIS GAME. Totally worth it.

SensacioFU*CKINGnice... quem curtiu bioshock 1 e 2 não vai se arrepender... Otimos graficos, Otima jogabilidade.... vale cada centavo. Uma das melhores historias que ja joguei... sem mais comentarios. nota 11/10 =D
This was not a game; This was an experience.

Years from now when I look back on this generation of games Bioshock Infinite will be the first game I bring up. From the moment you step foot in Columbia to the mind blowing conclusion, Infinite leaves a lasting impression on you. Every moment is a treat whether you are exploring or in the heat of battle. A game that is both fun and thought provoking. Infinite should not be missed by anyone who calls themselves a gamer.

Bioshock Infinite is a solid shooter with one of the best storylines I have ever experienced in a video game. Play Bioshock first, Bioshock Infinite second, and the Burial at Sea DLC third. This is one game saga you do not want to miss.

1,2のビッグダディ、ビッグシスターのような魅力的な敵キャラクターが存在しない。
ソングバードって鳥人間が一応いるんだけど全然出てこないし本編に全然関わってこない。
ただ、武器や特殊能力がちゃんと調整されてるのでどれも強くて楽しかった。
FPSとしてはかなり楽しめるように仕上がってますが、
1,2みたいにストーリーを楽しんだり世界観をじっくり探ってく楽しみが全然ないです。

風呂敷を広げすぎて上手くまとめられてない感じがすごい。
一言で言うとバイオショック無印のスタンドアロンDLCって感じ。
この作品での行動はすべてバイオショックのグッドエンディングにつながる。
というかあのグッドエンディングに到達するためにいろいろ”やらされてた”ってのが正解っぽい。

DLCも含めてこのゲームをやるつもりなら、
是非ゲオなりで初代バイオショック日本語版を買って遊んでからやりましょう。

シナリオの作品単体でのまとまりなんかはすごいイマイチ感ありますけど、
ゲームとしては相当面白い部類に入るので是非プレイしてほしい。
Better than Bioshock 2 and just as good as the original! PLAY IT!!

After all the hype over the past year and more, I didn't think this game was going to live up to it's reputation. Yeah, I was wrong. I never finished the first Bioshock because the the story forced such a disconnect between the player and the characters in the game world that I lost interest.  Bioshock Infinte is the opposite. Not only did I finish this game, but I was sad there wasn't more. The story is fantastic, and will keep you guessing. There will be some unanswered questions, so make your peace with that going in. Perhaps some future DLC....

The game is solid in almost every regard. It looks great and plays great, even though the gameplay is almost entirely "here's a bunch of dudes, shoot them all" because it at least gives you a bunch of fun toys to shoot those dudes with and a nice, three-dimensions-of-movement battlefield to shoot them in. They didn't reinvent the wheel with the gameplay, but honestly I wouldn't expect them to take any risks there with a title as big as Bioshock, anyway; at least for me, they more than made up for it with the beautiful world they built--this fun guns-blazing romp is supported by a good story with better writing and better still voice acting.

At the end of the day, the game is fun, gorgeous, and more clever than it needed to be, which was well worth the asking price--if you can get it on sale, don't hesitate.

There are no words to describe how awesome this game is.
Great story, and ending is something what you cant imagine.
excelente game me agrado y tiene unos graficos sss geniales jaja
